ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the category of the medical history?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MHCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology (e.g., CARDIAC, GENERAL). This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. This would be used when specific medical history (e.g., disease under study details) is captured, in addition to the general medical history.
